skill.name: senior-fullstack
skill.description: Comprehensive fullstack development skill for building complete web applications with React, Next.js, Node.js, GraphQL, and PostgreSQL. Includes project scaffolding, code quality analysis, architecture patterns, and complete tech stack guidance. Use when building new projects, analyzing code quality, implementing design patterns, or setting up development workflows.
skill.summary: Comprehensive fullstack development skill for building complete web applications with React, Next.js...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This skill contains documentation and utility Python scripts for project scaffolding and code quality analysis. All scripts operate locally, read user-specified paths, and generate reports. No network calls, no external command execution, and no credential access. The static scanner flagged 72 false positives, primarily from documentation examples and hash identifiers in JSON metadata.

content.value_statement: Building fullstack web applications requires deep knowledge of many technologies and patterns. This skill provides scaffolding tools, code quality analysis, and architecture guidance for React, Next.js, Node.js, GraphQL, and PostgreSQL projects.
actual_capabilities: Scaffold new fullstack projects with React, Next.js, Node.js, GraphQL, and PostgreSQL
Analyze code quality and generate detailed reports
Apply architecture patterns for scalable web applications
Set up development workflows following best practices
Configure Docker, Kubernetes, and CI/CD pipelines
Implement security best practices for web applications
limitations: Does not execute code or make network requests to external services
Does not modify files outside the user-specified project directory
Scripts are templates that require custom implementation for full functionality
Does not provide runtime debugging or live application monitoring

use_cases.title: Start new projects
use_cases.description: Quickly scaffold new fullstack applications with best practice structure and configurations

use_cases.title: Enforce standards
use_cases.description: Analyze existing codebases and apply architecture patterns for consistent quality

use_cases.title: Configure deployments
use_cases.description: Set up containerized deployments with Docker, Kubernetes, and CI/CD pipelines

prompt_templates.title: Scaffold project
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the senior-fullstack skill to scaffold a new project at /path/to/project with React frontend, Node.js/Express backend, PostgreSQL database, and GraphQL API. Include Docker configuration.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze codebase
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the code quality analyzer on my project at /path/to/project. Show me findings and recommendations for improvement.

prompt_templates.title: Apply patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me implement the repository pattern in my Node.js backend. Show example code structure from the architecture patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Setup CI/CD
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up GitHub Actions workflow for my fullstack project. Include testing, building, and Docker image deployment to container registry.

output_examples.input: Scaffold a new Next.js project with TypeScript, Prisma, and PostgreSQL
output: Project structure created successfully
Frontend: Next.js 14 with App Router and TypeScript
Backend: Next.js API routes with Prisma ORM
Database: PostgreSQL schema with User and Post models
Authentication: NextAuth.js configured
Styling: Tailwind CSS with custom theme
Testing: Jest and React Testing Library setup
Docker: Multi-stage build configuration
Next steps: Run npm install and configure .env file

output_examples.input: Analyze my React project for code quality issues
output: Analysis complete: 12 files scanned
Critical issues: 0
High priority: 3 (missing error boundaries, unsafe hooks usage)
Medium priority: 7 (prop type warnings, unused imports)
Low priority: 2 (minor formatting issues)
Recommendations: Add React Error Boundary components, fix all useEffect dependencies, remove unused imports

output_examples.input: Show me the repository pattern for Node.js
output: Repository Pattern Structure:
src/repositories/user.repository.ts - Data access layer
src/services/user.service.ts - Business logic layer
src/controllers/user.controller.ts - Request handling layer
Benefits: Separation of concerns, testability, flexible data sources
Example: UserRepository interface with CRUD methods

best_practices: Use the scaffolder tools to establish consistent project structure across your team
Run code quality analysis before major releases to catch issues early
Follow the architecture patterns documentation for scalable, maintainable code
anti_patterns: Do not skip the architecture review phase when scaling applications
Avoid mixing architectural patterns inconsistently within the same project
Do not rely solely on automated tools without understanding the underlying principles

faq.question: Which frameworks and databases are supported?
faq.answer: Supports React, Next.js, Node.js, Express, GraphQL, REST APIs, PostgreSQL, Prisma, NeonDB, and Supabase.

faq.question: What are the resource limits for generated projects?
faq.answer: The skill does not impose limits. Generated code follows best practices for scalability.

faq.question: Can I integrate with existing codebases?
faq.answer: Yes. The analyzer works on any directory. The scaffolder can add new components to existing projects.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. Scripts run locally and only access paths you specify. No code is sent to external services.

faq.question: Why does nothing happen when I run the scripts?
faq.answer: The scripts are scaffold templates with placeholder logic. Use the skill for guidance and implement custom logic as needed.

faq.question: How does this compare to other scaffolding tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides Claude Code integration with comprehensive fullstack patterns. Use alongside create-next-app or similar tools for best results.
